Write with blood, and you will experience that blood is spirit.\r\n\r\nIt is not easily possible to understand the blood of another: I hate the reading idlers.\r\n\r\nWhoever knows the reader will do nothing more for the reader. One more century of readers \u2013 and the spirit itself will stink.\r\n\r\nThat everyone is allowed to learn to read ruins not only writing in the long run, but thinking too.\r\n\r\nOnce the spirit was God, then it became human and now it is even becoming rabble.\r\n\r\nWhoever writes in blood and proverbs does not want to be read, but to be learned by heart.\r\n\r\nIn the mountains the shortest way is from peak to peak, but for that one must have long legs. Proverbs should be peaks, and those who are addressed should be great and tall.\r\n\r\nThe air thin and pure, danger near and the spirit full of cheerful spite: these fit together well.\r\n\r\nI want to have goblins around me, for I am courageous. Courage that scares off ghosts creates its own goblins \u2013 courage wants to laugh.\r\n\r\nI no longer sympathize with you; this cloud beneath me, this black and heavy thing at which I laugh \u2013 precisely this is your thundercloud.\r\n\r\nYou look upward when you long for elevation. And I look down because I am elevated.\r\n\r\nWho among you can laugh and be elevated at the same time?\r\n\r\nWhoever climbs the highest mountain laughs at all tragic plays and tragic realities.\r\n\r\nCourageous, unconcerned, sarcastic, violent \u2013 thus wisdom wants us: she is a woman and always loves only a warrior.\r\n\r\nYou say to me: \u201cLife is hard to bear.\u201d But why would you have your pride in the morning and your resignation in the evening?\r\n\r\nLife is hard to bear: but then do not carry on so tenderly! We are all of us handsome, load bearing jack- and jillasses.\r\n\r\nWhat have we in common with the rosebud that trembles because a drop of dew lies on its body?\r\n\r\nIt is true: we love life not because we are accustomed to life but because we are accustomed to love.\r\n\r\nThere is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.\r\n\r\nAnd even to me, one who likes life, it seems butterflies and soap bubbles and whatever is of their kind among human beings know most about happiness.\r\n\r\nTo see these light, foolish, delicate, sensitive little souls fluttering \u2013 that seduces Zarathustra to tears and songs.\r\n\r\nI would only believe in a god who knew how to dance.\r\n\r\nAnd when I saw my devil, there I found him earnest, thorough, deep, somber: it was the spirit of gravity \u2013 through him all things fall.\r\n\r\nNot by wrath does one kill, but by laughing. Up, let us kill the spirit of gravity!\r\n\r\nI learned to walk, since then I let myself run. I learned to fly, since then I do not wait to be pushed to move from the spot.\r\n\r\nNow I am light, now I fly, now I see myself beneath me, now a god dances through me.\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 22}, {"data": {"uuid": "c172a365-8d01-4da3-b22e-635de1ca290a", "user": 1, "title": "On the Tree on the Mountain", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:16:45.796633+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:16:45.810004+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On the Tree on the Mountain</h2><p>Zarathustra\u2019s eyes had discerned that a young man avoided him. As he walked one evening alone through the mountains surrounding the town, which is called The Motley Cow, behold, there while walking he found this young man leaning against a tree, gazing wearily into the valley. Zarathustra grasped the tree at which the young man sat, and spoke thus:</p><p>\u201cIf I wanted to shake this tree here with my hands, I would not be able to.</p><p>But the wind that we do not see torments and bends it wherever it wants. We are bent and tormented worst by invisible hands.\u201d</p><p>Then the young man stood up, perplexed, and said: \u201cI hear Zarathustra and I was just thinking about him.\u201d Zarathustra responded:</p><p>\u201cWhy are you startled by this? \u2013 But it is with human beings as it is with this tree.</p><p>The more they aspire to the heights and the light, the more strongly their roots strive earthward, downward, into darkness, depths \u2013 into evil.\u201d</p><p>\u201cYes, into evil!\u201d cried the young man. \u201cHow is it possible that you discovered my soul?\u201d</p><p>Zarathustra smiled and said: \u201cSome souls will never be discovered, unless they are first invented.\u201d</p><p>\u201cYes, into evil!\u201d cried the young man again.</p><p>\u201cYou speak the truth, Zarathustra. I no longer trust myself since aspiring to the heights, and no one trusts me anymore \u2013 how did this happen?</p><p>I\u2019m changing too fast. My today contradicts my yesterday. I often skip steps when I climb \u2013 no step forgives me that.</p><p>If I am at the top then I always find myself alone. No one speaks with me, the frost of loneliness makes me shiver. What do I want in the heights?</p><p>How ashamed I am of my climbing and stumbling! How I mock my violent panting! How I hate the flying one! How weary I am in the heights!\u201d</p><p>Here the young man fell silent. And Zarathustra regarded the tree at which they stood and spoke thus:</p><p>\u201cThis tree stands here lonely on the mountain; it grew high beyond humans and animals.</p><p>And if it wanted to speak, it would have no one who understood it: so high it grew.</p><p>Now it waits and waits \u2013 but for what does it wait? It lives too near the clouds\u2019 abode: it waits for the first lightning bolt?\u201d</p><p>When Zarathustra had said this the young man cried out, gesturing agitatedly: \u201cYes, Zarathustra, you speak the truth. I longed for my destruc- tion when I aspired to the heights, and you are the lightning for which I waited! Look, what am I anymore, now that you have appeared among us! It is my envy of you that has destroyed me!\u201d \u2013 Thus spoke the young man and he wept bitterly. But Zarathustra put his arm around him and led him away.</p><p>And after they had walked together for a while Zarathustra started speaking thus:</p><p>\u201cIt tears my heart apart. Better than your words can say, your eyes tell me all your danger.</p><p>You are still not free, you seek freedom. Your seeking made you sleep-deprived and over-awake.</p><p>You aspire to the free heights, your soul thirsts for the stars. But your wicked instincts also thirst for freedom.</p><p>Your wild dogs want to get free; they bark with joy in their cellar when your spirit contrives to liberate all prisons.</p><p>To me you are still a prisoner who plots his freedom. Alas, the soul of such prisoners grows clever, but also deceptive and rotten.</p><p>The one who is free of spirit must still purify himself. Much prison and mold is left in him: his eyes must still become pure.</p><p>Yes, I know your danger. But by my love and hope I beseech you: do not throw away your love and hope!</p><p>You still feel noble, and the others who grudge you and give you the evil eye, they still feel your nobility too. Know that a noble person stands in everyone\u2019s way.</p><p>A noble person also stands in the way of the good: and even when they call him a good man, they do so in order to get rid of him.</p><p>The noble person wants to create new things and a new virtue. The good person wants old things, and for old things to be preserved.</p><p>But it is not the danger of the noble one that he will become a good person, but a churl, a mocker, an annihilator.</p><p>Oh, I knew noble people who lost their highest hope. And then they slandered all high hopes.</p><p>Then they lived churlishly in brief pleasures, scarcely casting their goals beyond the day.</p><p>\u2018Spirit is lust too\u2019 \u2013 so they spoke. Then the wings of their spirit broke, and now it crawls around and soils what it gnaws.</p><p>Once they thought of becoming heroes: now they are libertines. To them the hero is grief and ghastliness.</p><p>But by my love and hope I beseech you: do not throw away the hero in your soul! Hold holy your highest hope!\u201d \u2013</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On the Tree on the Mountain", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Zarathustra\u2019s eyes had discerned that a young man avoided him. But your wicked instincts also thirst for freedom.\r\n\r\nYour wild dogs want to get free; they bark with joy in their cellar when your spirit contrives to liberate all prisons.\r\n\r\nTo me you are still a prisoner who plots his freedom. Alas, the soul of such prisoners grows clever, but also deceptive and rotten.\r\n\r\nThe one who is free of spirit must still purify himself. Much prison and mold is left in him: his eyes must still become pure.\r\n\r\nYes, I know your danger. But by my love and hope I beseech you: do not throw away your love and hope!\r\n\r\nYou still feel noble, and the others who grudge you and give you the evil eye, they still feel your nobility too. Know that a noble person stands in everyone\u2019s way.\r\n\r\nA noble person also stands in the way of the good: and even when they call him a good man, they do so in order to get rid of him.\r\n\r\nThe noble person wants to create new things and a new virtue. The good person wants old things, and for old things to be preserved.\r\n\r\nBut it is not the danger of the noble one that he will become a good person, but a churl, a mocker, an annihilator.\r\n\r\nOh, I knew noble people who lost their highest hope. May they be lured from this life with the \u201ceternal life!\u201d</p><p>\u201cYellow ones,\u201d so the preachers of death are called, or \u201cblack ones.\u201d But I want to show them to you in still different colors.</p><p>There are the terrible ones, who carry the predator about in themselves and have no choice but lust or self-laceration. And even their lusting is self-laceration.</p><p>They have not even become human beings, these terrible ones: may they preach departure from life and pass away themselves!</p><p>There are the consumptive of the soul: scarcely are they born when they begin to die and long for the teachings of weariness and resignation.</p><p>They would like to be dead and we shall honor their will! Let us beware of waking these dead and disturbing these living coffins!</p><p>They encounter a sick or a very old person or a corpse, and right away they say \u201clife is refuted!\u201d</p><p>But only they are refuted and their eyes, which see only the one face of existence.</p><p>Cloaked in thick melancholy and greedy for the small accidents that bring death, thus they wait and clench their teeth.</p><p>Or again: they reach for candy while mocking their childishness; they cling to their straw of life and mock the fact that they cling to a straw.</p><p>Their wisdom says: \u201cA fool who goes on living, but we are such fools! And precisely that is the most foolish thing about life!\u201d</p><p>\u201cLife is only suffering,\u201d so speak others, and do not lie; then see to it that you cease. Then see to it that the life that is only suffering ceases!</p><p>And let the doctrine of your virtue speak thus: \u201cThou shalt kill thyself! Thou shalt steal thyself away!\u201d</p><p>\u201cSex is sin,\u201d say the ones who preach death \u2013 \u201clet us step aside and not beget children!\u201d</p><p>\u201cGiving birth is strenuous,\u201d \u2013 say the others \u2013 \u201cwhy continue to give birth? One bears only the unhappy!\u201d And they too are preachers of death.</p><p>\u201cPity is needed,\u201d \u2013 so say the third kind. \u201cTake what I have! Take what I am! All the less does life bind me!\u201d</p><p>If they were the pitying kind through and through, they would ruin the lives of their neighbors. Being evil \u2013 that would be their proper goodness.</p><p>But they want to get free of life; what do they care that they bind others still tighter with their chains and gifts!</p><p>And you too, for whom life is hectic work and unrest: are you not very weary of life? Are you not very ripe for the sermon of death?</p><p>All of you who are in love with hectic work and whatever is fast, new, strange \u2013 you find it hard to bear yourselves, your diligence is escape and the will to forget yourself.</p><p>If you believed more in life, you would hurl yourself less into the moment. But you do not have enough content in yourselves for waiting \u2013 not even for laziness!</p><p>Everywhere sounds the voice of those who preach death: and the earth is full of people to whom departure from life must be preached.</p><p>Or \u201cthe eternal life.\u201d It\u2019s all the same to me \u2013 if only they pass away quickly!</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On the Preachers of Death", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "There are preachers of death, and the earth is full of people to whom departure from life must be preached.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "The earth is full of the superfluous, life is spoiled by the all too many. May they be lured from this life with the \u201ceternal life!\u201d\r\n\r\n\u201cYellow ones,\u201d so the preachers of death are called, or \u201cblack ones.\u201d But I want to show them to you in still different colors.\r\n\r\nThere are the terrible ones, who carry the predator about in themselves and have no choice but lust or self-laceration. And even their lusting is self-laceration.\r\n\r\nThey have not even become human beings, these terrible ones: may they preach departure from life and pass away themselves!\r\n\r\nThere are the consumptive of the soul: scarcely are they born when they begin to die and long for the teachings of weariness and resignation.\r\n\r\nThey would like to be dead and we shall honor their will! Let us beware of waking these dead and disturbing these living coffins!\r\n\r\nThey encounter a sick or a very old person or a corpse, and right away they say \u201clife is refuted!\u201d\r\n\r\nBut only they are refuted and their eyes, which see only the one face of existence.\r\n\r\nCloaked in thick melancholy and greedy for the small accidents that bring death, thus they wait and clench their teeth.\r\n\r\nOr again: they reach for candy while mocking their childishness; they cling to their straw of life and mock the fact that they cling to a straw.\r\n\r\nTheir wisdom says: \u201cA fool who goes on living, but we are such fools! And precisely that is the most foolish thing about life!\u201d\r\n\r\n\u201cLife is only suffering,\u201d so speak others, and do not lie; then see to it that you cease. Then see to it that the life that is only suffering ceases!\r\n\r\nAnd let the doctrine of your virtue speak thus: \u201cThou shalt kill thyself! Thou shalt steal thyself away!\u201d\r\n\r\n\u201cSex is sin,\u201d say the ones who preach death \u2013 \u201clet us step aside and not beget children!\u201d\r\n\r\n\u201cGiving birth is strenuous,\u201d \u2013 say the others \u2013 \u201cwhy continue to give birth? One bears only the unhappy!\u201d And they too are preachers of death.\r\n\r\n\u201cPity is needed,\u201d \u2013 so say the third kind. \u201cTake what I have! Take what I am! All the less does life bind me!\u201d\r\n\r\nIf they were the pitying kind through and through, they would ruin the lives of their neighbors. Being evil \u2013 that would be their proper goodness.\r\n\r\nBut they want to get free of life; what do they care that they bind others still tighter with their chains and gifts!\r\n\r\nAnd you too, for whom life is hectic work and unrest: are you not very weary of life? Are you not very ripe for the sermon of death?\r\n\r\nAll of you who are in love with hectic work and whatever is fast, new, strange \u2013 you find it hard to bear yourselves, your diligence is escape and the will to forget yourself.\r\n\r\nIf you believed more in life, you would hurl yourself less into the moment. But you do not have enough content in yourselves for waiting \u2013 not even for laziness!\r\n\r\nEverywhere sounds the voice of those who preach death: and the earth is full of people to whom departure from life must be preached.\r\n\r\nOr \u201cthe eternal life.\u201d It\u2019s all the same to me \u2013 if only they pass away quickly!\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 24}, {"data": {"uuid": "e65b6f1b-502b-4983-9417-1e3fb01327cd", "user": 1, "title": "On War and Warriors", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:18:24.193715+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:18:24.209122+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On War and Warriors</h2><p>We do not want to be spared by our best enemies, nor by those whom we love thoroughly. So let me tell you the truth now!</p><p>My brothers in war! I love you thoroughly, I am and I was like you. And I am also your best enemy. So let me tell you the truth now!</p><p>I know of the hate and envy of your heart. You are not great enough to not know hate and envy. So at least be great enough to not be ashamed of them!</p><p>And if you cannot be saints of knowledge, then at least be its warriors. They are the companions and forerunners of such saintliness.</p><p>I see many soldiers: if only I saw many warriors! \u201cUni-form\u201d one calls what they wear: if only what they conceal with it were not uni-form!</p><p>You should be the kind of men whose eyes always seek an enemy \u2013 your enemy. And with some of you there is a hate at first sight.</p><p>You should seek your enemy, wage your war and for your thoughts! And when your thought is defeated, then your honesty should cry out in triumph even for that!</p><p>You should love peace as the means to new wars. And the short peace more than the long one.</p><p>I do not recommend work to you, but struggle instead. I do not recommend peace to you, but victory instead. Your work shall be a struggle, your peace shall be a victory!</p><p>One can be silent and sit still only when one has a bow and arrow; otherwise there is blabbering and quarreling. Your peace shall be a victory!</p><p>You say it is the good cause that hallows even war? I tell you: it is the good war that hallows any cause.</p><p>War and courage have done more great things than love of one\u2019s neigh- bor. Not your pity but your bravery has rescued the casualties so far.</p><p>What is good? you ask. Being brave is good. Let little girls say: \u201cBeing good is what is pretty and stirring at the same time.\u201d</p><p>You are called heartless, but your heart is genuine and I love the shame of your heartiness. You are ashamed of your flood, and others are ashamed of their ebb.</p><p>You are ugly? Well so be it, my brothers! Then don the sublime, the mantle of the ugly!</p><p>And when your soul grows big it becomes mischievous, and there is sarcasm in your sublimity. I know you.</p><p>In sarcasm the mischievous one and the weakling meet. But they mis- understand one another. I know you.</p><p>You may have only those enemies whom you can hate, but not enemies to despise. You must be proud of your enemy: then the successes of your enemy are your successes too.</p><p>Rebellion \u2013 that is the nobility of slaves. Let your nobility be obedience! Your commanding itself shall be obeying!</p><p>To a good warrior \u201cthou shalt\u201d sounds nicer than \u201cI will.\u201d And everything you hold dear you should first have commanded to you.</p><p>Let your love for life be love for your highest hope, and let your highest hope be the highest thought of life!</p><p>But you shall have your highest thought commanded by me \u2013 and it says: human being is something that shall be overcome.</p><p>So live your life of obedience and war! What matters living long! Which warrior wants to be spared!</p><p>I spare you not, I love you thoroughly, my brothers in war! \u2013</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On War and Warriors", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "We do not want to be spared by our best enemies, nor by those whom we love thoroughly. What matters living long! Which warrior wants to be spared!\r\n\r\nI spare you not, I love you thoroughly, my brothers in war! \u2013\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 25}, {"data": {"uuid": "0592408c-0e61-437d-ab91-0366e2ca6d47", "user": 1, "title": "On the New Idol", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:19:17.750825+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:19:17.764398+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On the New Idol</h2><p>Somewhere still there are peoples and herds, but not where we live, my brothers: here there are states.</p><p>State? What is that? Well then, lend me your ears now, for I shall say my words about the death of peoples.</p><p>State is the name of the coldest of all cold monsters. It even lies coldly, and this lie crawls out of its mouth: \u201cI, the state, am the people.\u201d</p><p>This is a lie! The ones who created the peoples were the creators, they hung a faith and a love over them, and thus they served life.</p><p>The ones who set traps for the many and call them \u201cstate\u201d are annihi- lators, they hang a sword and a hundred cravings over them.</p><p>Where there are still peoples the state is not understood, and it is hated as the evil eye and the sin against customs and rights.</p><p>This sign I give you: every people speaks its own tongue of good and evil \u2013 which the neighbor does not understand. It invented its own language through customs and rights.</p><p>But the state lies in all the tongues of good and evil, and whatever it may tell you, it lies \u2013 and whatever it has, it has stolen.</p><p>Everything about it is false; it bites with stolen teeth, this biting dog. Even its entrails are false.</p><p>Language confusion of good and evil: this sign I give you as the sign of the state. Indeed, this sign signifies the will to death! Indeed, it beckons the preachers of death!</p><p>Far too many are born: the state was invented for the superfluous!</p><p>Just look at how it lures them, the far-too-many! How it gulps and chews and ruminates them!</p><p>\u201cOn earth there is nothing greater than I: the ordaining finger of God am I\u201d \u2013 thus roars the monster. And not only the long-eared and the shortsighted sink to their knees!</p><p>Oh, even to you, you great souls, it whispers its dark lies! Unfortunately it detects the rich hearts who gladly squander themselves!</p><p>Yes, it also detects you, you vanquishers of the old God! You grew weary in battle and now your weariness still serves the new idol!</p><p>It wants to gather heroes and honorable men around itself, this new idol! Gladly it suns itself in the sunshine of your good consciences \u2013 the cold monster!</p><p>It wants to give you everything, if you worship it, the new idol. Thus it buys the shining of your virtue and the look in your proud eyes.</p><p>It wants to use you as bait for the far-too-many! Indeed, a hellish piece of work was thus invented, a death-horse clattering in the regalia of divine honors!</p><p>Indeed, a dying for the many was invented here, one that touts itself as living; truly, a hearty service to all preachers of death!</p><p>State I call it, where all are drinkers of poison, the good and the bad; state, where all lose themselves, the good and the bad; state, where the slow suicide of everyone is called \u2013 \u201clife.\u201d</p><p>Just look at these superfluous! They steal for themselves the works of the inventors and the treasures of the wise: education they call their thievery \u2013 and everything turns to sickness and hardship for them!</p><p>Just look at these superfluous! They are always sick, they vomit their gall and call it the newspaper. They devour one another and are not even able to digest themselves.</p><p>Just look at these superfluous! They acquire riches and yet they become poorer. They want power and first of all the crowbar of power, much money \u2013 these impotent, impoverished ones!</p><p>Watch them scramble, these swift monkeys! They scramble all over each other and thus drag one another down into the mud and depths.</p><p>They all want to get to the throne, it is their madness \u2013 as if happiness sat on the throne! Often mud sits on the throne \u2013 and often too the throne on mud.</p><p>Mad all of them seem to me, and scrambling monkeys and overly aroused. Their idol smells foul to me, the cold monster: together they all smell foul to me, these idol worshipers.</p><p>My brothers, do you want to choke in the reek of their snouts and cravings? Smash the windows instead and leap into the open!</p><p>Get out of the way of the bad smell! Go away from the idol worship of the superfluous!</p><p>Get out of the way of the bad smell! Get away from the steam of these human sacrifices!</p><p>Even now the earth stands open for great souls. Many seats are still empty for the lonesome and twosome, fanned by the fragrance of silent seas.</p><p>An open life still stands open for great souls. Indeed, whoever possesses little is possessed all the less: praised be a small poverty!</p><p>There, where the state ends, only there begins the human being who is not superfluous; there begins the song of necessity, the unique and irreplaceable melody.</p><p>There, where the state ends \u2013 look there, my brothers! Do you not see it, the rainbow and the bridges of the overman? \u2013</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On the New Idol", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Somewhere still there are peoples and herds, but not where we live, my brothers: here there are states.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "State? Do you not see it, the rainbow and the bridges of the overman? \u2013", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Thus spoke Zarathustra.", "type": "text"}]}]}, "article_text": "On the New Idol\r\n\r\nSomewhere still there are peoples and herds, but not where we live, my brothers: here there are states.\r\n\r\nState? What is that? Well then, lend me your ears now, for I shall say my words about the death of peoples.\r\n\r\nState is the name of the coldest of all cold monsters. It even lies coldly, and this lie crawls out of its mouth: \u201cI, the state, am the people.\u201d\r\n\r\nThis is a lie! The ones who created the peoples were the creators, they hung a faith and a love over them, and thus they served life.\r\n\r\nThe ones who set traps for the many and call them \u201cstate\u201d are annihi- lators, they hang a sword and a hundred cravings over them.\r\n\r\nWhere there are still peoples the state is not understood, and it is hated as the evil eye and the sin against customs and rights.\r\n\r\nThis sign I give you: every people speaks its own tongue of good and evil \u2013 which the neighbor does not understand. It invented its own language through customs and rights.\r\n\r\nBut the state lies in all the tongues of good and evil, and whatever it may tell you, it lies \u2013 and whatever it has, it has stolen.\r\n\r\nEverything about it is false; it bites with stolen teeth, this biting dog. Even its entrails are false.\r\n\r\nLanguage confusion of good and evil: this sign I give you as the sign of the state. Indeed, this sign signifies the will to death! Indeed, it beckons the preachers of death!\r\n\r\nFar too many are born: the state was invented for the superfluous!\r\n\r\nJust look at how it lures them, the far-too-many! How it gulps and chews and ruminates them!\r\n\r\n\u201cOn earth there is nothing greater than I: the ordaining finger of God am I\u201d \u2013 thus roars the monster. And not only the long-eared and the shortsighted sink to their knees!\r\n\r\nOh, even to you, you great souls, it whispers its dark lies! Unfortunately it detects the rich hearts who gladly squander themselves!\r\n\r\nYes, it also detects you, you vanquishers of the old God! You grew weary in battle and now your weariness still serves the new idol!\r\n\r\nIt wants to gather heroes and honorable men around itself, this new idol! Gladly it suns itself in the sunshine of your good consciences \u2013 the cold monster!\r\n\r\nIt wants to give you everything, if you worship it, the new idol. Thus it buys the shining of your virtue and the look in your proud eyes.\r\n\r\nIt wants to use you as bait for the far-too-many! Indeed, a hellish piece of work was thus invented, a death-horse clattering in the regalia of divine honors!\r\n\r\nIndeed, a dying for the many was invented here, one that touts itself as living; truly, a hearty service to all preachers of death!\r\n\r\nState I call it, where all are drinkers of poison, the good and the bad; state, where all lose themselves, the good and the bad; state, where the slow suicide of everyone is called \u2013 \u201clife.\u201d\r\n\r\nJust look at these superfluous! They steal for themselves the works of the inventors and the treasures of the wise: education they call their thievery \u2013 and everything turns to sickness and hardship for them!\r\n\r\nJust look at these superfluous! They are always sick, they vomit their gall and call it the newspaper. They devour one another and are not even able to digest themselves.\r\n\r\nJust look at these superfluous! They acquire riches and yet they become poorer. They want power and first of all the crowbar of power, much money \u2013 these impotent, impoverished ones!\r\n\r\nWatch them scramble, these swift monkeys! They scramble all over each other and thus drag one another down into the mud and depths.\r\n\r\nThey all want to get to the throne, it is their madness \u2013 as if happiness sat on the throne! Often mud sits on the throne \u2013 and often too the throne on mud.\r\n\r\nMad all of them seem to me, and scrambling monkeys and overly aroused. Their idol smells foul to me, the cold monster: together they all smell foul to me, these idol worshipers.\r\n\r\nMy brothers, do you want to choke in the reek of their snouts and cravings? Smash the windows instead and leap into the open!\r\n\r\nGet out of the way of the bad smell! Go away from the idol worship of the superfluous!\r\n\r\nGet out of the way of the bad smell! Get away from the steam of these human sacrifices!\r\n\r\nEven now the earth stands open for great souls. Many seats are still empty for the lonesome and twosome, fanned by the fragrance of silent seas.\r\n\r\nAn open life still stands open for great souls. Indeed, whoever possesses little is possessed all the less: praised be a small poverty!\r\n\r\nThere, where the state ends, only there begins the human being who is not superfluous; there begins the song of necessity, the unique and irreplaceable melody.\r\n\r\nThere, where the state ends \u2013 look there, my brothers! Do you not see it, the rainbow and the bridges of the overman? \u2013\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 26}, {"data": {"uuid": "e25a688e-1cab-4718-b9ab-498804cd2521", "user": 1, "title": "On the Flies of the Market Place", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:20:35.139711+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:20:35.154355+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On the Flies of the Market Place</h2><p>Flee, my friend, into your solitude! I see you dazed by the noise of the great men and stung by the stings of the little.</p><p>Wood and cliff know worthily how to keep silent with you. Be once more like the tree that you love, the broad-branching one: silent and listening it hangs over the sea.</p><p>Where solitude ends, there begins the market place; and where the market place begins, there begins too the noise of the great actors and the buzzing of poisonous flies.</p><p>In the world even the best things are still worthless without the one person who first performs them: the people call these great men performers.</p><p>The people little understand what is great, that is: the creator. But they have a sense for all performers and actors of great things.</p><p>The world revolves around the inventors of new values: \u2013 it revolves invisibly. But the people and fame revolve around actors: thus is the course of the world.</p><p>Spirit the actor has, but little conscience of spirit. He always believes in whatever makes people believe most strongly \u2013 believe in him!</p><p>Tomorrow he will have a new belief and the day after tomorrow an even newer one. He has hasty senses, like the people, and a fickle ability to scent.</p><p>To overthrow \u2013 to him that means: to prove. To drive insane \u2013 to him that means: to convince. And blood to him is the best of all possible grounds.</p><p>A truth that slips into only the finer ears he calls a lie and nothing. Indeed, he only believes in gods that make great noise in the world!</p><p>The market place is full of pompous jesters \u2013 and the people are proud of their great men! They are the men of the hour.</p><p>But the hour presses them, and so they press you. And from you too they want a Yes or a No. Alas, do you want to set your chair between pro and contra?</p><p>Be without envy on account of these unconditional and pressing types, you lover of truth! Never before has truth hung on the arm of an absolutist.</p><p>Return to your safety on account of these precipitous types: only in the market place is one assaulted with Yes? or No?</p><p>For all deep wells experience is slow; they must wait long before they know what fell into their depth.</p><p>Away from the market place and fame all greatness takes place; away from the market place and fame the inventors of new values have lived all along.</p><p>Flee, my friend, into your solitude: I see you stung by poisonous flies. Flee where raw, strong air blows!</p><p>Flee into your solitude! You have lived too long near the small and the pitiful. Flee their invisible revenge! Against you they are nothing but revenge.</p><p>Do not raise your arm against them anymore! They are innumerable, and it is not your lot to be a shoo-fly.</p><p>Innumerable are these small and pitiful ones; and rain drops and weeds have sufficed to bring down many a proud structure.</p><p>You are no stone, but already you have become hollow from many drops. You will shatter and burst still from many drops.</p><p>I see you weary from poisonous flies, torn bloody in a hundred places, and yet your pride does not even become angered.</p><p>They want blood from you in all innocence, their bloodless souls demand blood \u2013 and so they sting away in all innocence.</p><p>But you, deep one, you suffer too deeply even from small wounds; and before you could even heal yourself, the same poisonous worm crawled across your hand.</p><p>You are too proud to slay these sweet-toothed creatures. But beware, or it will become your doom to bear all their poisonous injustice!</p><p>They also buzz around you with their praise; importunity is their praising! They want the closeness of your skin and your blood.</p><p>They flatter you like a god or devil; they snivel before you as before a god or devil. What\u2019s the use! They are sycophants and snivelers and nothing more.</p><p>Often too they give themselves charming airs. But that has always been the cleverness of cowards; yes, cowards are clever!</p><p>They think about you much with their narrow souls \u2013 you always give them pause! Everything that is thought about much gives pause.</p><p>They punish you for all your virtues. What they forgive you thoroughly are only \u2013 your mistakes.</p><p>Because you are mild and of just temperament, you say: \u201cThey are not guilty of their petty existence.\u201d But their narrow souls think: \u201cAll great existence is guilty.\u201d</p><p>Even when you are mild toward them they still feel despised by you; and they repay your benefaction with hidden malefactions.</p><p>Your wordless pride always contradicts their taste; they jubilate if only you are modest enough to be vain.</p><p>That which we recognize in a person we also inflame in him \u2013 therefore beware of the petty!</p><p>They feel small before you, and their baseness glimmers and glows at you in invisible revenge.</p><p>Haven\u2019t you noticed how often they fall silent when you approach them, and how their strength abandoned them like the smoke of a dying fire?</p><p>Yes my friend, you are the bad conscience of your neighbors, for they are unworthy of you. Therefore they hate you and would like much to suck your blood.</p><p>Your neighbors will always be poisonous flies; that which is great in you \u2013 that itself must make them more poisonous and ever more fly-like.</p><p>Flee, my friend, into your solitude and where raw, strong air blows! It is not your lot to be a shoo-fly. \u2013</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On the Flies of the Market Place", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Flee, my friend, into your solitude! I see you dazed by the noise of the great men and stung by the stings of the little.\r\n\r\nWood and cliff know worthily how to keep silent with you. Be once more like the tree that you love, the broad-branching one: silent and listening it hangs over the sea.\r\n\r\nWhere solitude ends, there begins the market place; and where the market place begins, there begins too the noise of the great actors and the buzzing of poisonous flies.\r\n\r\nIn the world even the best things are still worthless without the one person who first performs them: the people call these great men performers.\r\n\r\nThe people little understand what is great, that is: the creator. But they have a sense for all performers and actors of great things.\r\n\r\nThe world revolves around the inventors of new values: \u2013 it revolves invisibly. But the people and fame revolve around actors: thus is the course of the world.\r\n\r\nSpirit the actor has, but little conscience of spirit. He always believes in whatever makes people believe most strongly \u2013 believe in him!\r\n\r\nTomorrow he will have a new belief and the day after tomorrow an even newer one. He has hasty senses, like the people, and a fickle ability to scent.\r\n\r\nTo overthrow \u2013 to him that means: to prove. To drive insane \u2013 to him that means: to convince. And blood to him is the best of all possible grounds.\r\n\r\nA truth that slips into only the finer ears he calls a lie and nothing. Indeed, he only believes in gods that make great noise in the world!\r\n\r\nThe market place is full of pompous jesters \u2013 and the people are proud of their great men! They are the men of the hour.\r\n\r\nBut the hour presses them, and so they press you. And from you too they want a Yes or a No. Alas, do you want to set your chair between pro and contra?\r\n\r\nBe without envy on account of these unconditional and pressing types, you lover of truth! Never before has truth hung on the arm of an absolutist.\r\n\r\nReturn to your safety on account of these precipitous types: only in the market place is one assaulted with Yes? or No?\r\n\r\nFor all deep wells experience is slow; they must wait long before they know what fell into their depth.\r\n\r\nAway from the market place and fame all greatness takes place; away from the market place and fame the inventors of new values have lived all along.\r\n\r\nFlee, my friend, into your solitude: I see you stung by poisonous flies. Flee where raw, strong air blows!\r\n\r\nFlee into your solitude! You have lived too long near the small and the pitiful. Flee their invisible revenge! Against you they are nothing but revenge.\r\n\r\nDo not raise your arm against them anymore! They are innumerable, and it is not your lot to be a shoo-fly.\r\n\r\nInnumerable are these small and pitiful ones; and rain drops and weeds have sufficed to bring down many a proud structure.\r\n\r\nYou are no stone, but already you have become hollow from many drops. You will shatter and burst still from many drops.\r\n\r\nI see you weary from poisonous flies, torn bloody in a hundred places, and yet your pride does not even become angered.\r\n\r\nThey want blood from you in all innocence, their bloodless souls demand blood \u2013 and so they sting away in all innocence.\r\n\r\nBut you, deep one, you suffer too deeply even from small wounds; and before you could even heal yourself, the same poisonous worm crawled across your hand.\r\n\r\nYou are too proud to slay these sweet-toothed creatures. But beware, or it will become your doom to bear all their poisonous injustice!\r\n\r\nThey also buzz around you with their praise; importunity is their praising! They want the closeness of your skin and your blood.\r\n\r\nThey flatter you like a god or devil; they snivel before you as before a god or devil. What\u2019s the use! They are sycophants and snivelers and nothing more.\r\n\r\nOften too they give themselves charming airs. But that has always been the cleverness of cowards; yes, cowards are clever!\r\n\r\nThey think about you much with their narrow souls \u2013 you always give them pause! Everything that is thought about much gives pause.\r\n\r\nThey punish you for all your virtues. What they forgive you thoroughly are only \u2013 your mistakes.\r\n\r\nBecause you are mild and of just temperament, you say: \u201cThey are not guilty of their petty existence.\u201d But their narrow souls think: \u201cAll great existence is guilty.\u201d\r\n\r\nEven when you are mild toward them they still feel despised by you; and they repay your benefaction with hidden malefactions.\r\n\r\nYour wordless pride always contradicts their taste; they jubilate if only you are modest enough to be vain.\r\n\r\nThat which we recognize in a person we also inflame in him \u2013 therefore beware of the petty!\r\n\r\nThey feel small before you, and their baseness glimmers and glows at you in invisible revenge.\r\n\r\nHaven\u2019t you noticed how often they fall silent when you approach them, and how their strength abandoned them like the smoke of a dying fire?\r\n\r\nYes my friend, you are the bad conscience of your neighbors, for they are unworthy of you. Therefore they hate you and would like much to suck your blood.\r\n\r\nYour neighbors will always be poisonous flies; that which is great in you \u2013 that itself must make them more poisonous and ever more fly-like.\r\n\r\nFlee, my friend, into your solitude and where raw, strong air blows! It is not your lot to be a shoo-fly. \u2013\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 27}, {"data": {"uuid": "951e3872-ba76-4b7c-8f13-8ff8ee0cfdab", "user": 1, "title": "On Chastity", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:21:19.635311+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:21:19.647532+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On Chastity</h2><p>I love the forest. It is bad to live in the cities; there too many are in heat.</p><p>Is it not better to fall into the hands of a murderer than into the dreams of a woman in heat?</p><p>And just look at these men: their eyes say it \u2013 they know nothing better on earth than to lie with a woman.</p><p>There is mud at the bottom of their souls; and watch out if their mud has spirit too!</p><p>If only you were perfect at least as animals! But to animals belongs innocence.</p><p>Do I advise you to kill your senses? I advise you on the innocence of your senses.</p><p>Do I advise you to chastity? In some people chastity is a virtue, but in many it is almost a vice.</p><p>They abstain, to be sure: but the bitch, sensuality, leers with envy out of everything they do.</p><p>Even into the heights of their virtue and all the way into their cold spirit this beast follows them with its unrest.</p><p>And how sweetly the bitch, sensuality, knows how to beg for a piece of spirit when she is denied a piece of meat!</p><p>You love tragedies and everything that makes the heart break? But I am mistrustful of your bitch.</p><p>Your eyes are too cruel for me and they gaze with lust in search of sufferers. Has your lust not simply disguised itself, and now calls itself pity?</p><p>And this parable too I give to you: not a few who wanted to drive out their devil went into swine themselves.</p><p>Those for whom chastity is difficult should be advised against it, or else it could become their road to hell \u2013 that is, the mud and the heat of the soul.</p><p>Do I speak of dirty things? That is not the worst of it to me.</p><p>Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow the seeker of knowledge steps reluctantly into its water.</p><p>Indeed, there are chaste people through and through; they are milder of heart, they laugh more gladly and more richly than you.</p><p>They laugh at chastity too and ask: \u201cwhat is chastity?</p><p>Is chastity not folly? But this folly came to us, and not we to it.</p><p>We offered this guest hostel and heart: now it dwells with us \u2013 may it stay as long as it wants!\u201d</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On Chastity", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "I love the forest. It is bad to live in the cities; there too many are in heat.\r\n\r\nIs it not better to fall into the hands of a murderer than into the dreams of a woman in heat?\r\n\r\nAnd just look at these men: their eyes say it \u2013 they know nothing better on earth than to lie with a woman.\r\n\r\nThere is mud at the bottom of their souls; and watch out if their mud has spirit too!\r\n\r\nIf only you were perfect at least as animals! But to animals belongs innocence.\r\n\r\nDo I advise you to kill your senses? I advise you on the innocence of your senses.\r\n\r\nDo I advise you to chastity? In some people chastity is a virtue, but in many it is almost a vice.\r\n\r\nThey abstain, to be sure: but the bitch, sensuality, leers with envy out of everything they do.\r\n\r\nEven into the heights of their virtue and all the way into their cold spirit this beast follows them with its unrest.\r\n\r\nAnd how sweetly the bitch, sensuality, knows how to beg for a piece of spirit when she is denied a piece of meat!\r\n\r\nYou love tragedies and everything that makes the heart break? But I am mistrustful of your bitch.\r\n\r\nYour eyes are too cruel for me and they gaze with lust in search of sufferers. Has your lust not simply disguised itself, and now calls itself pity?\r\n\r\nAnd this parable too I give to you: not a few who wanted to drive out their devil went into swine themselves.\r\n\r\nThose for whom chastity is difficult should be advised against it, or else it could become their road to hell \u2013 that is, the mud and the heat of the soul.\r\n\r\nDo I speak of dirty things? That is not the worst of it to me.\r\n\r\nNot when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow the seeker of knowledge steps reluctantly into its water.\r\n\r\nIndeed, there are chaste people through and through; they are milder of heart, they laugh more gladly and more richly than you.\r\n\r\nThey laugh at chastity too and ask: \u201cwhat is chastity?\r\n\r\nIs chastity not folly? But this folly came to us, and not we to it.\r\n\r\nWe offered this guest hostel and heart: now it dwells with us \u2013 may it stay as long as it wants!\u201d\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 28}, {"data": {"uuid": "6b65bd0b-3dd6-49df-b687-9892b6eba8eb", "user": 1, "title": "On the Friend", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:22:04.272265+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:22:04.285295+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On the Friend</h2><p>\u201cOne is always too many around me\u201d \u2013 thus thinks the hermit. \u201cAlways one times one \u2013 in the long run that makes two!\u201d</p><p>I and me are always too eager in conversation: how could I stand it if there were no friend?</p><p>For the hermit the friend is always a third: the third is the cork that prevents the conversation of the two from sinking into the depths.</p><p>Oh, there are too many depths for all hermits. That is why they long so for a friend and his height.</p><p>Our faith in others betrays the areas in which we would like to have faith in ourselves. Our longing for a friend is our betrayer.</p><p>And often one uses love merely to leap over envy. And often one attacks and makes an enemy in order to conceal that one is open to attack.</p><p>\u201cAt least be my enemy!\u201d \u2013 Thus speaks true respect that does not dare to ask for friendship.</p><p>If one wants a friend, then one must also want to wage war for him: and in order to wage war, one must be able to be an enemy.</p><p>One should honor the enemy even in one\u2019s friend. Can you step up to your friend without stepping over to him?</p><p>In one\u2019s friend one should have one\u2019s best enemy. You should be closest to him in heart when you resist him.</p><p>You want to wear no garb before your friend? Is it supposed to be to your friend\u2019s honor that you give yourself to him as you are? But for that he curses you to the devil!</p><p>Whoever makes no secret of himself outrages others; so much reason do you have to fear nakedness! Indeed, if you were gods then you could be ashamed of your clothing!</p><p>For your friend you cannot groom yourself beautifully enough, for you should be his arrow and longing for the overman.</p><p>Have you ever seen your friend sleeping \u2013 so that you discover how he really looks? What after all is the face of your friend? It is your own face, in a rough and imperfect mirror.</p><p>Have you ever seen your friend sleeping? Weren\u2019t you startled that your friend looks as he does? Oh my friend, human being is something that must be overcome.</p><p>The friend should be a master of guessing and keeping silent: you must not want to see everything. Your dream should reveal to you what your friend does while waking.</p><p>Let your compassion be a guessing, so that you might first know whether your friend wants compassion. Perhaps what he loves in you is your unbroken eye and the look of eternity.</p><p>Let compassion for your friend conceal itself beneath a hard shell, so that in biting on it you lose a tooth! That way it will have its delicacy and sweetness.</p><p>Are you pure air and solitude and bread and medicine to your friend? Many cannot loosen their own chains and yet they are a redeemer for the friend.</p><p>Are you a slave? Then you cannot be a friend. Are you a tyrant? Then you cannot have friends.</p><p>All too long a slave and a tyrant have been concealed in woman. That is why woman is not yet capable of friendship: she knows only love.</p><p>In the love of a woman are injustice and blindness toward everything that she does not love. And even in the knowing love of a woman there is everywhere still assault and lightning and night next to light.</p><p>Woman is not yet capable of friendship: women are still cats, and birds. Or, at best, cows.</p><p>Woman is not yet capable of friendship. But tell me, you men, who then among you is capable of friendship?</p><p>Oh how repulsive is your poverty, you men, and the stinginess of your souls! As much as you give your friend I will give even to my enemy, and would not be poorer for it.</p><p>There is comradeship: may there be friendship!</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On the Friend", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "\u201cOne is always too many around me\u201d \u2013 thus thinks the hermit. \u201cAlways one times one \u2013 in the long run that makes two!\u201d", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "I and me are always too eager in conversation: how could I stand it if there were no friend?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "For the hermit the friend is always a third: the third is the cork that prevents the conversation of the two from sinking into the depths.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Oh, there are too many depths for all hermits. No greater market place on earth did Zarathustra find than good and evil.</p><p>No people could live that did not first esteem; but if they want to preserve themselves, then they must not esteem as their neighbor esteems.</p><p>Much that was called good by this people was called scorn and disgrace by another: thus I found. Much I found that was called evil here and decked in purple honors there.</p><p>Never did one neighbor understand the other: always his soul was amazed at his neighbor\u2019s delusion and malice.</p><p>A tablet of the good hangs over every people. Observe, it is the tablet of their overcomings; observe, it is the voice of their will to power.</p><p>Praiseworthy to them is whatever they consider difficult; what is indis- pensable and difficult, is called good, and whatever stems from the highest need and still liberates, the rarest, the most difficult \u2013 that is praised as holy.</p><p>Whatever lets them rule and triumph and shine, to the dread and envy of their neighbor, that they consider as the high, the first, the measuring, the meaning of all things.</p><p>Truly, my brother, once you discover a people\u2019s need and land and sky and neighbor, you guess as well the law of their overcomings, and why they climb on this ladder to their hope.</p><p>\u201cAlways you shall be the first and tower above others: no one shall your jealous soul love, unless it is the friend\u201d \u2013 this is what made the soul of a Greek tremble: with this he walked the path of greatness.</p><p>\u201cSpeak the truth and be skilled with the bow and arrow\u201d \u2013 this seemed both dear and difficult to the people from whom my name derives \u2013 the name that is both dear and difficult to me.</p><p>\u201cHonor father and mother and comply with their will down to the roots of one\u2019s soul\u201d \u2013 this tablet of overcoming a different people hung over themselves and became powerful and eternal thereby.</p><p>\u201cPractice loyalty and for loyalty\u2019s sake risk honor and blood even on evil and dangerous things\u201d \u2013 teaching themselves thus another people conquered themselves, and thus conquering themselves they became pregnant and heavy with great hopes.</p><p>Indeed, humans gave themselves all of their good and evil. Indeed, they did not take it, they did not find it, it did not fall to them as a voice from heaven.</p><p>Humans first placed values into things, in order to preserve themselves \u2013 they first created meaning for things, a human meaning!</p><p>That is why they call themselves \u201chuman,\u201d that is: the esteemer.</p><p>Esteeming is creating: hear me, you creators! Esteeming itself is the treasure and jewel of all esteemed things.</p><p>Only through esteeming is there value, and without esteeming the nut of existence would be hollow. Hear me, you creators!</p><p>Change of values \u2013 that is the change of creators. Whoever must be a creator always annihilates.</p><p>First peoples were creators and only later individuals; indeed, the individual himself is still the youngest creation.</p><p>Peoples once hung a tablet of the good over themselves. Love that wants to rule and love that wants to obey such tablets created together.</p><p>Delight in the herd is older than delight in the ego, and as long as good conscience is synonymous with herd, only bad conscience says: ego.</p><p>Truly, the sly ego, loveless, wanting its benefit in the benefit of the many: that is not the origin of the herd, but instead its going under.</p><p>It was always lovers and creators who created good and evil. The fire of love glows in the names of all virtues and the fire of wrath.</p><p>Zarathustra saw many lands and many peoples: no greater power did Zarathustra find on earth than the works of the lovers: \u201cgood\u201d and \u201cevil\u201d are their names.</p><p>Truly, a behemoth is the power of this praising and blaming. Tell me, who will conquer it for me, you brothers? Tell me, who will throw the fetters over the thousand necks of this beast?</p><p>A thousand goals there have been until now, for there have been a thousand peoples. Only the fetters for the thousand necks are still missing, the one goal is missing. Humanity still has no goal.</p><p>But tell me, my brothers: if humanity still lacks a goal, does it not also still lack \u2013 humanity itself? \u2013</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On a Thousand and One Goals", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "Many lands Zarathustra saw and many peoples; thus he discovered many peoples\u2019 good and evil. No greater market place on earth did Zarathustra find than good and evil.\r\n\r\nNo people could live that did not first esteem; but if they want to preserve themselves, then they must not esteem as their neighbor esteems.\r\n\r\nMuch that was called good by this people was called scorn and disgrace by another: thus I found. Much I found that was called evil here and decked in purple honors there.\r\n\r\nNever did one neighbor understand the other: always his soul was amazed at his neighbor\u2019s delusion and malice.\r\n\r\nA tablet of the good hangs over every people. Observe, it is the tablet of their overcomings; observe, it is the voice of their will to power.\r\n\r\nPraiseworthy to them is whatever they consider difficult; what is indis- pensable and difficult, is called good, and whatever stems from the highest need and still liberates, the rarest, the most difficult \u2013 that is praised as holy.\r\n\r\nWhatever lets them rule and triumph and shine, to the dread and envy of their neighbor, that they consider as the high, the first, the measuring, the meaning of all things.\r\n\r\nTruly, my brother, once you discover a people\u2019s need and land and sky and neighbor, you guess as well the law of their overcomings, and why they climb on this ladder to their hope.\r\n\r\n\u201cAlways you shall be the first and tower above others: no one shall your jealous soul love, unless it is the friend\u201d \u2013 this is what made the soul of a Greek tremble: with this he walked the path of greatness.\r\n\r\n\u201cSpeak the truth and be skilled with the bow and arrow\u201d \u2013 this seemed both dear and difficult to the people from whom my name derives \u2013 the name that is both dear and difficult to me.\r\n\r\n\u201cHonor father and mother and comply with their will down to the roots of one\u2019s soul\u201d \u2013 this tablet of overcoming a different people hung over themselves and became powerful and eternal thereby.\r\n\r\n\u201cPractice loyalty and for loyalty\u2019s sake risk honor and blood even on evil and dangerous things\u201d \u2013 teaching themselves thus another people conquered themselves, and thus conquering themselves they became pregnant and heavy with great hopes.\r\n\r\nIndeed, humans gave themselves all of their good and evil. Indeed, they did not take it, they did not find it, it did not fall to them as a voice from heaven.\r\n\r\nHumans first placed values into things, in order to preserve themselves \u2013 they first created meaning for things, a human meaning!\r\n\r\nThat is why they call themselves \u201chuman,\u201d that is: the esteemer.\r\n\r\nEsteeming is creating: hear me, you creators! Esteeming itself is the treasure and jewel of all esteemed things.\r\n\r\nOnly through esteeming is there value, and without esteeming the nut of existence would be hollow. Hear me, you creators!\r\n\r\nChange of values \u2013 that is the change of creators. Whoever must be a creator always annihilates.\r\n\r\nFirst peoples were creators and only later individuals; indeed, the individual himself is still the youngest creation."}, "id": 30}, {"data": {"uuid": "9a1957fb-82fa-44e0-b2b4-049baadb685a", "user": 1, "title": "On Love of the Neighbor", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:23:44.975930+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:23:44.995176+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On Love of the Neighbor</h2><p>You crowd around your neighbor and you have pretty words for it. But I say to you: your love of the neighbor is your bad love of yourselves.</p><p>You flee to your neighbor to escape yourself and you want to make a virtue of it: but I see through your \u201cselflessness.\u201d</p><p>The You is older than the I; the You is pronounced sacred, but not yet the I: and so humans crowd around their neighbors.</p><p>Do I recommend love of the neighbor to you? I prefer instead to rec- ommend flight from the neighbor and love of the farthest!</p><p>Higher than love of the neighbor is love of the farthest and the future; higher still than love of human beings is love of things and ghosts.</p><p>This ghost that runs before you, my brother, is more beautiful than you; why do you not give it your flesh and your bones? But you are afraid and run to your neighbor.</p><p>You cannot stand yourselves and do not love yourselves enough: now you want to seduce your neighbor to love and gild yourselves with his error.</p><p>I wish you were unable to stand all these neighbors and their neighbors; then you would have to create your friend and his overflowing heart out of yourself.</p><p>You invite a witness when you want someone to speak well of you; and when you have seduced him into thinking well of you, you then think well of yourselves.</p><p>Not only he lies who speaks though he knows better, but the real liar is the one who speaks though he knows nothing. And so you visit each other and speak of yourselves and deceive your neighbor with yourselves.</p><p>Thus speaks the fool: \u201cThe company of people ruins one\u2019s character, especially when one has none.\u201d</p><p>One person goes to his neighbor because he seeks himself, and the other because he would like to lose himself. Your bad love of yourselves makes your loneliness into a prison.</p><p>Those farther away pay for your love of the neighbor; and even when you are together five at a time, always a sixth one must die.</p><p>Nor do I love your festivals: too many actors I found there, and even the spectators behaved often like actors.</p><p>I do not teach you the neighbor, but the friend. The friend shall be your festival of the earth and an anticipation of the overman.</p><p>I teach you the friend and his overflowing heart. But one must understand how to be a sponge, if one wants to be loved by overflowing hearts.</p><p>I teach you the friend in whom the world stands complete, a bowl of goodness \u2013 the creating friend who always has a complete world to bestow.</p><p>And just as the world rolled apart for him, so it rolled together again in rings, as the becoming of good through evil, as the becoming of purpose out of accident.</p><p>Let the future and the farthest be the cause of your today: in your friend you shall love the overman as your cause.</p><p>My brothers, I do not recommend love of the neighbor to you: I recommend love of the farthest to you.</p><p>Thus spoke Zarathustra.</p>", "article_json": {"type": "doc", "content": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2}, "content": [{"text": "On Love of the Neighbor", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "content": [{"text": "You crowd around your neighbor and you have pretty words for it. Do you want to seek the way to yourself? Linger a bit longer and listen to me.</p><p>\u201cWhoever seeks easily gets lost himself. All isolation is guilt,\u201d thus speaks the herd. And long have you belonged to the herd.</p><p>The voice of the herd will still resonate in you too. And when you will say \u201cI no longer am of one conscience with you,\u201d then it will be a lament and a pain.</p><p>Behold, this pain itself bore the one conscience, and the last shimmer of this conscience still glows on your misery.</p><p>But you want to go the way of your misery, which is the way to yourself? Then show me your right and your strength to it!</p><p>Are you a new strength and a new right? A first movement? A wheel rolling out of itself? Can you compel even the stars to revolve around you?</p><p>Oh, there is so much lust for the heights! There are so many spasms of the ambitious! Show me that you are not one of the lustful and the ambitious!</p><p>Oh, there are so many great thoughts that do nothing more than a bellows: they puff up and make emptier.</p><p>You call yourself free? Your dominating thought I want to hear, and not that you escaped from a yoke.</p><p>Are you the kind of person who had the right to escape from a yoke? There are some who threw away their last value when they threw away their servitude.</p><p>Free from what? What does Zarathustra care! But brightly your eyes should signal to me: free for what?</p><p>Can you give yourself your own evil and good and hang your will above yourself like a law? Can you be your own judge and the avenger of your law?</p><p>It is terrible to be alone with the judge and avenger of one\u2019s own law. Thus does a star get thrown out into desolate space and into the icy breath of solitary being.</p><p>Today you suffer still from the many, you lonely one: for today you still have your courage and your hopes intact.</p><p>But one day solitude will make you weary, one day your pride will cringe and your courage will gnash its teeth. One day you will cry \u201cI am alone!\u201d</p><p>One day will you will no longer see your high, and your low will be all too near; your sublimity itself will frighten you like a ghost. One day you will cry: \u201cEverything is false!\u201d</p><p>There are feelings that want to kill the lonely one; if they do not suc- ceed, well, then they must die themselves! But are you capable of being a murderer?</p><p>Do you know the word \u201ccontempt\u201d yet, my brother? And the agony of your justice, namely to be just to those who despise you?</p><p>You compel many to relearn about you; they weigh that heavily against you. You came near to them and yet passed by: they will never forgive you that.</p><p>You pass over and beyond them, but the higher you climb the smaller you are to the eyes of envy. But the ones who fly they hate most.</p><p>\u201cHow would you be just toward me?\u201d \u2013 you must say \u2013 \u201cI choose your injustice as my fair share.\u201d</p><p>Injustice and filth they throw at the lonely one. But my brother, if you want to be a star then you must shine through for them all the more!</p><p>And beware of the good and the just! They like to crucify those who invent their own virtue \u2013 they hate the lonely one.</p><p>Beware too of holy simplicity! Everything is unholy to it that is not simple; it also likes to play with fire \u2013 the stake.</p><p>And beware of the attacks of your love! Too quickly the lonely one extends his hand to those he encounters.</p><p>To some people you should not give your hand, but instead only your paw: and I want that your paw also has claws.</p><p>But the worst enemy whom you can encounter will always be yourself; you ambush yourself in caves and woods.</p><p>Lonely one, you go the way to yourself! And past you yourself leads your way and past your seven devils!</p><p>To your own self you will be heretic and witch and soothsayer and fool and doubter and unholy man and villain.</p><p>You must want to burn yourself up in your own flame: how could you become new if you did not first become ashes!</p><p>Lonely one, you go the way of the creator: you will create yourself a god out of your seven devils!</p><p>Lonely one, you go the way of the lover: you love yourself and that is why you despise yourself as only lovers despise.</p><p>The lover wants to create because he despises! What does he know of love who did not have to despise precisely what he loved!</p><p>With your love go into your isolation and with your creativity, my brother; and only later will justice limp after you.</p><p>With my tears go into your isolation, my brother. Do you want to seek the way to yourself? Linger a bit longer and listen to me.\r\n\r\n\u201cWhoever seeks easily gets lost himself. All isolation is guilt,\u201d thus speaks the herd. And long have you belonged to the herd.\r\n\r\nThe voice of the herd will still resonate in you too. And when you will say \u201cI no longer am of one conscience with you,\u201d then it will be a lament and a pain.\r\n\r\nBehold, this pain itself bore the one conscience, and the last shimmer of this conscience still glows on your misery.\r\n\r\nBut you want to go the way of your misery, which is the way to yourself? Then show me your right and your strength to it!\r\n\r\nAre you a new strength and a new right? A first movement? A wheel rolling out of itself? Can you compel even the stars to revolve around you?\r\n\r\nOh, there is so much lust for the heights! There are so many spasms of the ambitious! Show me that you are not one of the lustful and the ambitious!\r\n\r\nOh, there are so many great thoughts that do nothing more than a bellows: they puff up and make emptier.\r\n\r\nYou call yourself free? Your dominating thought I want to hear, and not that you escaped from a yoke.\r\n\r\nAre you the kind of person who had the right to escape from a yoke? There are some who threw away their last value when they threw away their servitude.\r\n\r\nFree from what? What does Zarathustra care! But brightly your eyes should signal to me: free for what?\r\n\r\nCan you give yourself your own evil and good and hang your will above yourself like a law? Can you be your own judge and the avenger of your law?\r\n\r\nIt is terrible to be alone with the judge and avenger of one\u2019s own law. Thus does a star get thrown out into desolate space and into the icy breath of solitary being.\r\n\r\nToday you suffer still from the many, you lonely one: for today you still have your courage and your hopes intact.\r\n\r\nBut one day solitude will make you weary, one day your pride will cringe and your courage will gnash its teeth. One day you will cry \u201cI am alone!\u201d\r\n\r\nOne day will you will no longer see your high, and your low will be all too near; your sublimity itself will frighten you like a ghost. One day you will cry: \u201cEverything is false!\u201d\r\n\r\nThere are feelings that want to kill the lonely one; if they do not suc- ceed, well, then they must die themselves! But are you capable of being a murderer?\r\n\r\nDo you know the word \u201ccontempt\u201d yet, my brother? And the agony of your justice, namely to be just to those who despise you?\r\n\r\nYou compel many to relearn about you; they weigh that heavily against you. You came near to them and yet passed by: they will never forgive you that.\r\n\r\nYou pass over and beyond them, but the higher you climb the smaller you are to the eyes of envy. But the ones who fly they hate most.\r\n\r\n\u201cHow would you be just toward me?\u201d \u2013 you must say \u2013 \u201cI choose your injustice as my fair share.\u201d\r\n\r\nInjustice and filth they throw at the lonely one. But my brother, if you want to be a star then you must shine through for them all the more!\r\n\r\nAnd beware of the good and the just! They like to crucify those who invent their own virtue \u2013 they hate the lonely one.\r\n\r\nBeware too of holy simplicity! Everything is unholy to it that is not simple; it also likes to play with fire \u2013 the stake.\r\n\r\nAnd beware of the attacks of your love! Too quickly the lonely one extends his hand to those he encounters.\r\n\r\nTo some people you should not give your hand, but instead only your paw: and I want that your paw also has claws.\r\n\r\nBut the worst enemy whom you can encounter will always be yourself; you ambush yourself in caves and woods.\r\n\r\nLonely one, you go the way to yourself! And past you yourself leads your way and past your seven devils!\r\n\r\nTo your own self you will be heretic and witch and soothsayer and fool and doubter and unholy man and villain.\r\n\r\nYou must want to burn yourself up in your own flame: how could you become new if you did not first become ashes!\r\n\r\nLonely one, you go the way of the creator: you will create yourself a god out of your seven devils!\r\n\r\nLonely one, you go the way of the lover: you love yourself and that is why you despise yourself as only lovers despise.\r\n\r\nThe lover wants to create because he despises! What does he know of love who did not have to despise precisely what he loved!\r\n\r\nWith your love go into your isolation and with your creativity, my brother; and only later will justice limp after you.\r\n\r\nWith my tears go into your isolation, my brother. I love him who wants to create over and beyond himself and thus perishes. \u2013\r\n\r\nThus spoke Zarathustra."}, "id": 32}, {"data": {"uuid": "3801b850-b1b8-403c-8feb-55fdd84aa20f", "user": 1, "title": "On Little Women Old and Young", "created_on": "2023-05-10 14:25:16.575241+00:00", "updated_on": "2023-05-10 14:25:16.589388+00:00", "article_html": "<h2>On Little Women Old and Young</h2><p>\u201cWhy do you creep about so timidly in the twilight, Zarathustra? And what do you conceal so cautiously beneath your coat?</p><p>Is it a treasure that was given to you? Or a child that was born to you? Or do you yourself now walk the paths of thieves, you friend of the evil?\u201d \u2013</p><p>\u201cIndeed, my brother!\u201d spoke Zarathustra. \u201cIt is a treasure that was given to me: it is a little truth, which I carry.</p><p>But it is unruly like a young child, and if I do not hold its mouth shut, then it cries out too loudly.</p><p>As I went my way alone today, at the hour when the sun sets, I met a little old woman and she spoke thus to my soul:</p><p>\u2018Much has Zarathustra spoken also to us women, and yet he has never spoken to us about woman.\u2019</p><p>And I replied to her: \u2018About woman one should speak only to men.\u2019 \u2018Speak to me too about woman,\u2019 she said. \u2018I am old enough to forget it right away.\u2019</p><p>And I humored the little old woman and spoke thus to her:</p><p>Everything about woman is a riddle, and everything about woman has one solution: it is called pregnancy.</p><p>A man is for woman a means: the end is always the child. But what is woman for a man?</p><p>Two things the real man wants: danger and play. That is why he wants woman as the most dangerous plaything.</p><p>A man should be raised for war and woman for the recreation of the warrior: everything else is folly.</p><p>Fruits that are all too sweet \u2013 these the warrior does not like. Therefore he likes woman; even the sweetest woman is still bitter.</p><p>Better than a man, woman understands children, but a man is more childish than a woman.</p><p>In the real man a child is concealed: it wants to play. Up now, you women, go discover the child in the man!</p><p>Let woman be a plaything, pure and fine, like a gemstone radiated by the virtues of a world that does not yet exist.</p><p>Let the ray of a star shine in your love! Let your hope be called: \u2018May I give birth to the overman!\u2019</p><p>Let courage be in your love! With your love you should throw yourself at him who makes you afraid!</p><p>Let your honor be in your love! Otherwise woman understands little about honor. But let this be your honor: always to love more than you are loved, and never to be second.</p><p>Let a man be afraid of a woman when she loves; then she makes any sacrifice, and every other thing is without value to her.</p><p>Let a man be afraid of a woman when she hates; for at the bottom of his soul a man is merely evil, but woman is bad there.</p><p>Whom does a woman hate most? \u2013 Thus spoke the iron to the magnet: \u2018I hate you most because you attract, but are not strong enough to attract me to you.\u2019</p><p>The happiness of a man says: I will. The happiness of a woman says: he wills.</p><p>\u2018Behold, just now the world became perfect!\u2019 \u2013 Thus thinks every woman when she obeys out of total love.</p><p>And a woman must obey and find a depth for her surface. Surface is a woman\u2019s disposition, a flexible, stormy skin over shallow water. But a man\u2019s disposition is deep, his stream roars in underground caves; woman intuits his strength but does not comprehend it.\u201d \u2013</p><p>Then the little old woman replied to me: \u201cMuch that is sweet Zarathustra has said, and especially for those who are young enough for it.</p><p>Peculiar, though, that Zarathustra knows women only little, and yet he is right about them! Does this happen because with women nothing is impossible?</p><p>And now, by way of thanks, accept a little truth! Surely I am old enough for it!</p><p>Bundle it up and hold its mouth shut, or else it will cry out too loudly, this little truth.\u201d</p><p>\u201cGive me your little truth, woman!\u201d I said. And thus spoke the little old woman:</p><p>\u201cYou go to women?
